rev.diff:
Line 2: Line 2:
== Organization ==
== Organization ==
  +
[[File:Underground prison cell in Egyptian SS HQ.jpg|thumb|An underground cell in State Security Investigations Service]]
The SSI is a branch of the Interior Ministry in Egypt with an official aim of protecting the security of Egypt. The SSI has many official bureaus that provide its public face: an "Investigative Bureau" in the [[Lazoghli]] section of [[Cairo]],<ref>{{cite web | url=http://en.alkarama.org/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&catid=22:communiqu&id=234:egypt-whereabouts-of-17-people-held-incommunicado-between-1992-and-1997-leaked-by-released | title=Egypt: Whereabouts of 17 prisoners leaked by released prisoners | publisher=[[Alkarama]] for Human Rights | date=16 May 2009 | accessdate=10 March, 2011}}</ref> a "Supreme State Security Court" in [[Giza]], a "Supreme State Security Prosecution" (''Niyabat Amn al-Dawl a al-'Ulya''), etc. A diplomatic cable sent in 2007 published by ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'' as part of the [[United States diplomatic cables leak|leak of classified US diplomatic cables]] discussed what the then SSI head called the "excellent and strong" cooperation between the SSI and the United States [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]]. The cable also discussed the benefit the SSI derived from training opportunities at the FBI's Quantico, Virginia headquarters.<ref>[http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/wikileaks-files/8314530/FBI-DEPUTY-DIRECTOR-MEETS-WITH-HEAD-OF-STATE-SECURITY.html FBI DEPUTY DIRECTOR MEETS WITH HEAD OF STATE SECURITY] ''The Telegraph'', 9 February 2011.</ref>
The SSI is a branch of the Interior Ministry in Egypt with an official aim of protecting the security of Egypt. The SSI has many official bureaus that provide its public face: an "Investigative Bureau" in the [[Lazoghli]] section of [[Cairo]],<ref>{{cite web | url=http://en.alkarama.org/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&catid=22:communiqu&id=234:egypt-whereabouts-of-17-people-held-incommunicado-between-1992-and-1997-leaked-by-released | title=Egypt: Whereabouts of 17 prisoners leaked by released prisoners | publisher=[[Alkarama]] for Human Rights | date=16 May 2009 | accessdate=10 March, 2011}}</ref> a "Supreme State Security Court" in [[Giza]], a "Supreme State Security Prosecution" (''Niyabat Amn al-Dawl a al-'Ulya''), etc. A diplomatic cable sent in 2007 published by ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'' as part of the [[United States diplomatic cables leak|leak of classified US diplomatic cables]] discussed what the then SSI head called the "excellent and strong" cooperation between the SSI and the United States [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]]. The cable also discussed the benefit the SSI derived from training opportunities at the FBI's Quantico, Virginia headquarters.<ref>[http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/wikileaks-files/8314530/FBI-DEPUTY-DIRECTOR-MEETS-WITH-HEAD-OF-STATE-SECURITY.html FBI DEPUTY DIRECTOR MEETS WITH HEAD OF STATE SECURITY] ''The Telegraph'', 9 February 2011.</ref>
